website_summaries.verdict: Stylish coffee maker design that includes a copper boiling element for exact temperature settings.
pros: Coffee maker offered in more than a dozen colors for the brewer housing
Maintains precise temperature range for the water to produce the best-quality coffee
cons: Plastic parts on the carafe may not stand up to repeated use

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to not like this because I am not a coffee snob
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to not like this because I am not a coffee snob. I just got tired of spending $40+ every 18 months to buy a new coffee maker so I decided to try and find something with replaceable parts. I found this, read millions of reviews, bought it grudgingly, and then watched in fascination as the water went through the middle tube thing and brewed my first pot of Moccamaster coffe. Then this crazy thing happened...my coffee was good. REALLY good. Is it the placebo effect of spending this much money on a coffee maker? I don't know and I don't care. Just get in my belly.
customer_reviews.author: Mojo Mama

customer_reviews.title: not for everyone
customer_reviews.text: Initially because I liked the design so much and because it was a high-end coffee maker, I overlooked the fact that the carafe is pretty small, there is no feature that allows you to pour a cup while it is brewing, and the carafe only stays warm for 90 minutes (it seemed like less). However, several times now it has stopped dripping into the carafe and the water and coffee grinds are stuck to the filter cup, and it overflows and creates a huge huge mess. I've stopped using it and gone back to another brand. This is not a coffee maker that you expose to everyday use.
customer_reviews.author: Sophie

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't live up to the hype
customer_reviews.text: I've had this product for 3-4 weeks now. It's a nice coffee maker, and I like the fact that all the parts that the coffee runs through are removable and washable. And it's nicely compact. However, it's more than 3x the price of other "nice" coffee makers I've used, and I don't believe there's a difference in the taste or temperature of my coffee. The best part about it is the toggle on/off switch that allows me to use a smart plug to turn it on from my phone. I was really excited about it based on reviews, but if I was purchasing again, I'd get something else given I don't believe it's worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Don't get taken
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a good coffee maker that would make great coffee and last for years. This thing is the poorest excuse for a user friendly machine i've ever seen. It does make good coffee which is what attracted me to this machine which is why i ponyed up $350 for it. What a disappointment when i started to use it. Good coffee, yes, but lets face it, it's really not hat difficult to make a good cup of coffee. this thing is a challenge to add water, replace the filter, and add coffee grounds. Very poorly designed is all i can say. i am now looking to see what my return options are.
customer_reviews.author: Dave B

customer_reviews.title: We've all been duped.
customer_reviews.text: It pains me to say this...but I think I was duped. It's a neat little machine to be sure, but at 5x the price of a run of the mill machine, it does not produce a 5x increase in quality. I expected more from such a price, my mistake. I regret this purchase every morning. We are not rolling around in money, but we do spend a little extra for a quality cup of coffee. This machine was one such splurge...a splurge that was quickly followed by regret. Don't be duped...with a little effort and just $35 buy an Aeropress and you will have 10x the cup of coffee that this machine produces, I promise.
customer_reviews.author: Josh McMahan

customer_reviews.title: Makes Excellent Coffee...And That's The Goal, Right?
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent coffee maker. It's function is simple. It has an interesting Euro-design aesthetic. Most important, it produces fantastic coffee. The machine's operation is straightforward; however, one must take care not to put to much coffee in the filter/basket. Overfilling the filter/basket with coffee will likely result in a messy and inconvenient overflow. We use about 4/5 of a cup and have no issues. We use thefilters. Possibly the greatest thing about the machine is the quality of the coffee that it produces; it's easily the best coffee I've ever gotten out of a machine at home.
customer_reviews.author: F. McGee

customer_reviews.title: overpriced, for what it is
customer_reviews.text: Fine coffee, nothing spectacular, like a fine filtered french press. Too much plastic, I was hoping the water basin was glass but its plastic Its fairly fast but nothing extraordinary, the color is nice, it pops if you want a 'piece' for your counter than this is it, but you could probably spend 1/3 of the price and get the same cup of coffee
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: 9 Hole Drip System Does Not Work
customer_reviews.text: This is advertised as making a great cup of coffee due to a drip system that allows all the grounds to be penetrated with water from its 9 hole drip system. Unfortunately, it doesn't work. All of the wholes for dispersing water do disperse, but the water streams together and drips into the coffee in one single spot which defeats the whole purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Lorb

customer_reviews.title: Don't get taken in by all the HYPE.
customer_reviews.text: This coffeemaker was easy to use and clean. There is a lot of hype written about it by the manufacturer and the reviews. Don't get taken in by it. The coffee tastes good, but no better than any other drip coffeemaker. In my opinion, better tasting coffee comes from a percolator. And it's hotter also. There is also talk about the perfect brewing temperature (more hype). If you like hot coffee, it's a disappointment! The company talks about exact measures of coffee and water. In reality, it's how strong you like it! Quality is good. But plastic is plastic and glass is glass, just like all the rest. Bottom line: Not worth the money it costs.
customer_reviews.author: charles s.

customer_reviews.title: very quick and reliable
customer_reviews.text: It is used at home. I drink a lot of coffee. I bought this maker because after reading reviews of all the other reasonable coffee makers, I found on all to many negative reviews. Our last two coffee makers lasted just four months each. I want one that was reliable. Reviews of this coffee maker were much better. The Moccamaster is made in the Netherlands and is not fancy. It has a five year warranty. every part is functional and plain for that purpose. Coffee making is quick. The taste is good, I am very satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bev

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee from home!! Better then single served!!
customer_reviews.text: I seriously don't know how this got bad reviews. I also bought the top self brand store machine like $100. They always slow down within a year. My coffee always tasted cheap and sour. As a single mom I was like ugh with the price but I can't handle this bad tasting home coffee anymore. I made my first pot and I couldn't believe the same coffee grounds dd from wholesale club taste so freaking good in this pot. You can make it weak or strong.... it just taste so clean and good. Follow the directions and wet the filter like a commerical pot- had no issues with dry grounds as other comments.
customer_reviews.author: DonnaReedOnCRACK

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I honestly only bought this because I wanted a cool looking white coffee maker to go in my newly remodeled kitchen. And I hate the boxy look of cuisinart and other major brands. Not only does this one look awesome on my countertop, it turns out I really love the taste of the coffee it brews. There are only two things I don’t like, which is why I give it 4 instead of 5 stars—I wish the pot was bigger (12 cups instead of 10), and the pot leaks when it’s really full during a pour. That part drives me crazy but I still love it overall and plan/hope to keep it for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: L. L.

customer_reviews.title: Makes me feel like Goldilocks waiting for the Technivorm that's just right :-)
customer_reviews.text: The coffee it makes taste great! Makes even average ground coffee taste super, and good quality coffee tastes great. My issue is that the heating pad for the already brewed coffee is too hot, resulting in burned coffee within 10-15 minutes after brewing. I also have the Technivorm without the heating pad, which uses a thermal carafe. That one doesn't keep the coffee anywhere near hot enough. It's unfortunate that my only work around for this is an expensive Stanley Insulated thermos. I pour the hot coffee into it, which seems to work well. A small extra step to be sure, but at these prices, something unexpected.
customer_reviews.author: Ron R

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after months
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this machine. Previously I used a $45 Mr Coffee machine from Best Buy that lasted me 7 years. The Moccamaster lasted less that 8 months and refused to power on. Overall machine made good coffee but waking up at the crack of dawn to a faulty machine will make anyone’s day 180° into pretty much ruin. Very disappointed considering the cost of this machine, and the simplicity of a standard coffee machine. Do yourself a favor and don’t be fixated on “the golden cup” and go get yourself a reliable machine
customer_reviews.author: Areen M

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, functional, great coffee
customer_reviews.text: We bought this so I could make good morning coffee and not make a mess, but wanted one that would last a while. The carafe of the coffee maker we had always dripped or leaked. Well, this is just a functional, well-functioning coffee maker. My first coffee maker in the 1980s was much like this, simple and effective. We kept it until the carafe was broken about 10 years ago. We then bought complicated machines. My last one was a leaker. This is a good coffee maker. It is also a beautiful, cobalt blue. It is simple, makes a great cup of coffee. It is well made and functional.
customer_reviews.author: Lance K. Mertz

customer_reviews.title: NO way
customer_reviews.text: All the plastic bits on this machine does not at all feel like you are having the coffee experience it was meant (and priced) to be. The filter basket is the worst of all. it rests on top but not that well. All that I could have gotten past but there is a substantial amount of humidity that stays in the water basket. the other deal breaker for me was the inconsistent temperature this brewed at. Again - that is part of the appeal of this machine. I wanted to love it and was willing to love it - but not at the expense (no pun intended) of great coffee.
customer_reviews.author: bell

customer_reviews.title: Impeccable design and function
customer_reviews.text: simple design.. works to perfection.. I have owned many, many coffee makers in my life.. This one is outstanding. Love the simplicity and performance. The contemporary design is awesome for me.. I love it.. No leaks.. no problems.. My last Cuisinart was a disaster.. I had taken it back to Macys 3 times for a replacements due to leakage and poor performance.. after paying what i did, I wanted it to work??? silly me???.. finally disposed of it and purchased this gem.. have had it for 6 months at least.. It is awesome.. good luck in your search for a machine.. if this on your radar.. you will not be disappointed.. : )
customer_reviews.author: William Hertsenberg

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Received the Technivorm Moccamaster 40oz about a month ago. Thoroughly impressed with the coffee maker, and ultimately glad that I made the purchase. I was really worried about all of the complaints I read here and elsewhere about the coffee grounds not being fully saturated while brewing. Like so many people have said, the arm doesn’t extend far enough to hit all of the coffee grounds in the basket, but the water build up always saturates the grounds in mine. I’ve made several full pot and half pot brews, and this hasn’t been an issue. Also, the entire coffee maker seems to be high quality. Overall impressed. Will come back and change my review should I experience issues. P
customer_reviews.author: PF.

customer_reviews.title: Feels cheap for the high price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great coffee maker, brews delicious coffee and is easy to set up and clean. I was a little disappointed that there is so much plastic and a very thin glass carafe for such an expensive coffee maker. I Have been using my moccamaster for about 2 weeks and I have already cracked the carafe while cleaning. $35 for a new replacement Carafe, and I’m sure it won’t be my last. The unit looks nice on the counter top, but a little more quality could have been put into the details of the unit especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Coming from pour over, this saves time, and coffee temp is better.
customer_reviews.text: Great tasting coffee. Simple. Easy. Excellent build quality. Really enjoy the absence of displays and blinking lights. Possibly the biggest plus: I don't feel like this thing will be in a landfill a few years from now. Only complaint: The filter basket has a protrusion on the bottom that won't allow you to stand the basket on a counter top for filling. Not a big deal. You can either swing the shower arm away and fill it from its perch, or find something to set it in while filling.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hendershot

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee Cheap product
customer_reviews.text: First, let me say that this machine does make a fine cup of coffee, much better than my very old one that I’ve since retired. However when people say that it is cheaply made BELIEVE it. You must be paying for the engineering or maybe the guts of it. It is aesthetically pleasing to the eye, very pretty to me but the plastic material and construction is about as cheap as it gets. For the amount of money paid, top dollar it is definitely unacceptable. Come on Technivom stop ripping people off like this. You can do better or lower your price. Also none of this is dishwasher safe plastic or glass container.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Best drip coffee maker ever!
customer_reviews.text: I am a coffee freak. While I love my Nespresso machine for many reasons, especially the creaminess and richness of the coffee pods, sometimes I Just desire a good Cup of black coffee and want to add cream when wanted. This machine makes coffee fast, delicious and its sleek size fits perfectly on my counter and looks so nice! The process is unique compared to other drips (I won’t go into detail) but you Can read about it in the description. Very quiet, too. Pricey, but well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Karon E.

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee, not even missing my Aeropress that much.
customer_reviews.text: Up to purchasing this I had been using a French press or Aeropress for my coffee needs. But then we started hosted a weekly group study, and I needed to look at larger batches of coffee. Back in the day Cooks Illustrated did a comparison of drip machines, and the moccamaster won hands down. Took me a few brews to get the coffee grounds measured correctly and to find the right grind, but now it's producing excellent coffee without the hands on time of the other methods. Cleaning is easy, looks good on the counter, serves about 5 normal size cups of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: P. Trussell

customer_reviews.title: Best there is.
customer_reviews.text: Third one I’ve bought. 1st one was for my office. 2nd for the home. This one for my lake cabin. There truly isn’t a better tasting drip coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: JBE

customer_reviews.title: Makes excellent coffee and quickly
customer_reviews.text: We like this machine a lot. It makes excellent coffee. We brew 6 cups in around 3 minutes. The coffee stays quite hot for a good hour Its easy to disassemble and clean Our only complaint is for a very expensive machine it feels flimsy; the carafe is of minimal thickness and the weight of the plastic fixtures are very light. So, it feels very breakable and not durable. Time will tell about durability. That is our only complaint about an otherwise excellent product
customer_reviews.author: Stuart B. Mushlin

customer_reviews.title: Good coffeemaker but bad quality
customer_reviews.text: Machine makes good coffee however in 6 months the metal piece in the tank has started corroding. Looks like the chrome polish on top has come off. I would expect stainless steel for the price of this machine but clearly the quality is not where one would expect.
customer_reviews.author: Nital

customer_reviews.title: Not sure this lives up to the hype
customer_reviews.text: I've been making myself pour-over coffee for a while now. My friend told me this was the best drip coffee maker he's ever used, so when it went on sale for Black Friday, I thought I'd give it a try. I still feel like my pour-overs have substantially more flavor than using this machine. Perhaps if you drink drip coffee at baseline, you can taste a positive difference. But for me, I'll stick to my pour-over coffee and keep the extra cash in my wallet.
customer_reviews.author: Phil T.

customer_reviews.title: Love this Moccamaster!
customer_reviews.text: After enjoying a few hundred cups of coffee with this machine my wife and I came to the same conclusion – best and last coffee maker we will ever own. What we liked: Definite noticeable taste improvement – same coffee with improved taste Makes coffee really fast – faster than anything we’ve owned Easy to use – love the simplistic design that forfeits electronic gadgetry for a high quality build Hot plate never burns coffee Looks awesome Heavy duty electrical cord Has replaceable discrete parts Great warranty (5 years) What we didn’t like: Expensive (but feel we got what we paid for)
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: This brews coffee the right way!
customer_reviews.text: The key is how the water is dispersed over the grounds. This unit does it with a spray bar and cone filters. I use R/O water. First picture is what the grounds look like in the Moccamaster cone filter. Second picture is what the same amount of grounds looks like in a Hamilton Beach with a paper filter.
customer_reviews.author: Heavymetals

customer_reviews.title: I took forward to this coffee every single morning.
customer_reviews.text: Everyone has to do their own calculation about how much they want to spend on a coffeemaker, but I have to say this makes the best coffee I’ve ever made at home, as well as 95% of coffee I’ve bought outside my home. It’s certainly an indulgence to spend part of your kid’s college education money on a coffee machine, but they way I look at it is this coffee helps keep me working.
customer_reviews.author: Corey K.

customer_reviews.title: This Moccamaster is way ahead of the pack
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best drip coffee maker on the market in the $300 dollar range. It makes hot, tasty coffee; is fast and easy to clean, it doesn't drip on the hot plate and it doesn't have too many moving parts that can go wrong. This is my second Moccamaster and I intend to keep the old one as a back-up. I've tried a lot of coffee makers including various Cuisinarts and a Breville but they simply don't compare. This Moccamaster is way ahead of the pack.!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: I have always enjoyed my coffee
customer_reviews.text: I have always enjoyed my coffee. 3 years ago I quit drinking alcohol so now Idrink alot of coffee. THIS IS NO MR COFFEE! If you love coffee and have never had a maker like this you have no idea what you are missing! The coffee looks richer, smells richer and the taste is an OMG. Yes, it is a few extra dead presidents but so well worth it! I LOVE it and I am so glad I bought this. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: seawitch

customer_reviews.title: makes a great cup of coffee and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: our cuisinart was 4 years old and the taste of our morning coffee was starting to deteriorate, so we decided it was time to buy another. after doing some research we decided to splurge on the the mocamaster. the unit is very easy to use and does indeed make a full pot of coffee in about 6 minutes, faster than our old cuisinart. coffee tastes very good. there are 2 heat settings, and the hotter of the 2 does indeed keep the coffee at a perfect drinking temp. don't really have any negative things to say about this product. we like it and recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: jjb

customer_reviews.title: Best Home Coffee Brewer
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING!! The MoccaMaster ( with glass pot) brews the best cup of coffee I have had at home, very much like a French press. Very smooth and flavorful. Simple one touch ...add water and coffee and press the power button. No other controls ...but you don’t need any more. Brews a pot in six minutes. I even brewed some older beans to test the brewer and even that was excellent. I have tried many brewers expensive and less expensive...this is the best so far. A perfect cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Tim M

customer_reviews.title: For the price...
customer_reviews.text: ....no. Flimsy plastic. Too careful manipulation required for removal for cleaning and inserting filter to make coffee. Insufficient settings for the price. Coffee no better than OXO 9 cup coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Cape Codder

customer_reviews.title: Costly bummer
customer_reviews.text: On off switch failed two months after purchasing. Water reservoir lid develops mold under lid. This was a huge costly mistake. $300. Down the drain. Zero build quality. Zero design. I think that the manufacturer took advantage of a coffee lover and their desire for the ultimate cup of coffee. Be aware of this scam.
customer_reviews.author: Humboldt DaveOG

customer_reviews.title: Not the best coffee you can brew!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am VERY unhappy with the coffee from this unit. After extensive investigations we went with this unit and after about a month of trying to get a good - not great - cup of coffee I am about to give up! We have tried the suggested amounts of coffee, different grinds from our burr grinder, different amounts of water, and different coffee beans and NOTHING gives us the superior coffee represented by the company! This is soon to become a very expensive paperweight!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better flavor from even "Grocery Store" beans
customer_reviews.text: When you first open the box, it appears to need some assembly. In reality, no more than you will use for cleaning. Uses very common paper filters. The plastic materials used for some components are surprising at this price point, but in every day use they would be difficult to damage. Even inexpensive grocery store beans when freshly (medium) ground completely surprised me with the improved taste. The biggest surprise was my spouse started drinking my morning coffee for the first time in 10 years together.
customer_reviews.author: Carl in Katy

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This was a present for my Husbands Birthday. We had been using a small French Press and we needed something larger. He is a bit of a coffee snob and after some research, he found this coffee maker and was very impressed by all the good reviews. We’ve been using it for a little over a week now and are VERY happy with it! The coffee is delicious and it takes very little time to brew a whole pot! Also, it’s very easy to clean up afterwards! I would definitely recommend this to anyone! We love our Moccamaster!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Burton

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: This is the BEST coffee maker I've ever had. I've tried them all. French press, pour over, aero press, Nesspresso, Keurig, espresso makers and other filter coffee makers. In my opinion, the Moccamaster is quieter, quicker, and easier than I imagined was possible. They are beautifully well made. Had it a few months, so not sure if it will last 5, 10, or 20 years. Great Smooth coffee made quickly!
customer_reviews.author: Considerable

customer_reviews.title: Very nice coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after a lot of research, trying to find a carafe coffee maker that brewed at the perfect temperature and I am completely satisfied with the coffee this thing produces, and the overall operation such as the automatic cut off and the two temperature warming base. I bought it in a turquoise color and am delighted with the looks of this thing sitting on my counter!
customer_reviews.author: NDL

customer_reviews.title: My old Breville Kerig machine (which I loved the looks of) finally bit the dust
customer_reviews.text: My old Breville Kerig machine (which I loved the looks of) finally bit the dust. I looked at all the new models and did not like the appearance of any of them. My husband loves good coffee, so after much research and seeing the fantastic reviews, I purchased this. My husband and friends love the coffee. I do not drink coffee, so I go by their reviews and the appearance on my counter! They love the coffee and I love the look. The only con is that the cord is on the side of the machine instead of the back, and since I am the appearance person, this is a drawback but not enough to try something else.
customer_reviews.author: Jane doe

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee maker in the world
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker is hand made in Holland. The main structure is made of metal and incorporates a copper heating element. The brewing time for ten cups is about 6 to 7 minutes. I had used many brands of coffee makers in the past, but this Moccomaster makes best coffee I have ever had. I love the fact that there is only one switch( ON/OFF) to make coffee. In this case, less is more. This is the best coffee maker you can buy.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Desario

customer_reviews.title: Can't make a full carafe coffee anymore after several uses
customer_reviews.text: It makes very tasty, round and smooth coffee. But I didn't know that I need to purchase the gold filter separately. After using up the several paper filters came with it, we used the paper filters from Whole Foods. The machine then started giving us troubles. If we filled up the coffee holder , it wouldn't make any coffee. Now we can only put a little bit coffee to make it work, but we only get about three cups of coffee. The carafa is 1/3 full. I don't feel like going through the hessel to return it. Hoping it is the problem with the filter ? Or anyone knows what might be the problem?
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Looks fancy sitting on my counter, makes great tasting coffee.
customer_reviews.text: I love the way this coffee maker looks enough that I don't feel like I need to hide it when I'm done with my morning coffee. Which is nice, but what's important is that the coffee I get out of it is fantastic. It's almost like I was only able to taste half of the coffee bean with my old coffee maker, but this brings out the full flavor of the whole bean. Highly recommend, despite the rather steep price.
customer_reviews.author: Lara Buff

customer_reviews.title: Simple, Gorgeous and Delicious!
customer_reviews.text: I love the straightforwardness of this coffee maker. I personally dont want all the bells and whistles to make a delicious cup of coffee so this machine ws right up my alley. I would definitly buy again. I hope it lasts aslong as they claim (forever). Im very happy with it after about 6 months of using it. I used to buy the cheap-o coffee makers and figured there was no difference, but there definitely is and i'm glad i got something nicer this time!
customer_reviews.author: @mazon is why I'm broke!

customer_reviews.title: Hands down the best coffee maker out there
customer_reviews.text: Best coffee maker I've ever owned. I like coffee but have become a bit of a coffee snob. Starbucks just wasn't doing it for me and Keurig coffee is mediocre at best. So, I tossed the Keurig for this expensive contraption. This thing makes fantastic coffee -- what a huge difference. Worth the money if you can afford it.
customer_reviews.author: PAHunter

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: We really wanted to love it based on all the expert reviews but we just don’t. I wish we had returned it before the window closed. We had bought it as an anniversary gift for ourselves. The pot is small so we are always having to make a new pot and it takes so much coffee to make one small pot. It always makes a mess when you pour a cup. It is a beautiful machine but I wish we had not bought, especially at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Moccamaster coffee brewer
customer_reviews.text: it really does make a very good pot of coffee, 10 cup absolutely not, it makes 4 cups which I was willing to settle for as it makes it hot, it uses copper tubing instead of plastic or aluminum, the other reason is I can make another pot just as easy and its always fresh, its been some time since I have enjoyed my first cup of coffee in the morning as I do now
customer_reviews.author: michaelht1

customer_reviews.title: Makes Great Coffee
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased one of these years ago for our daughter. When our all-in-one Capresso finally died after 15 years of use, I purchased this coffee maker and it has made the best coffee, even better than my old Capresso. Easy to maintain and fast brewing. One thing -- after each brew remove the water well lid and let the well dry out so it does not yellow the plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We love this coffee maker.
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I drink a lot of coffee. We believe the pot is almost as important as the bean. We've been through several. This is by far one of our favorites. The coffee is consistently delicious, the temperature is always hot and there's never a burnt taste that you get with some other pots. We would buy this pot over and over again.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: Like most, i was hesitant to spend the money for the unit. however, i've been using it now for several months and i would recommend the money. the unit is very easy to use, stylish looking on the counter, nice low height making it easy to fill, easily cleaned and makes a great pot of coffee in about 4.5 min. love it and would purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: bella

customer_reviews.title: worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because it is not made in China. And wanted a coffee maker that stays hot. We use 60 grams for 30 onces. You must not look at the cup size on the machine, it's set for a 4 once cup, not 6. WE LOVE OUR MOCHAMASTER. We also buy freshly roasted coffee beans. Worth looking into and definitely worth the money. Sure it's a little expensive...you get what you pay for .
customer_reviews.author: ANTHONY SAITTA

customer_reviews.title: Makes “okay” coffee
customer_reviews.text: I want to start by saying I’m a total coffee snob. I hand grind my coffee to ensure it’s perfect. This coffee machine makes a decent cup of coffee but it takes a lot of grounds and makes a small amount of coffee. For over $300 I was expecting it to be fantastic and it was average at best. I would not recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Berserker

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced. Bunn Heat n Brew offers same brew temperature for much less money.
customer_reviews.text: Did no better than Bunn Heat and Brew, which costs a lot less and also heats the water reliably to around 200 F.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: 4.5 Review. Great Coffee Pot.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as my quarantine present to myself! Brewing takes a little bit of practice, finding out right water to coffee ratio as the hot water goes straight ontop of the grouds. I suggest reading the directions as it gives some helpful hints. Easy to clean. Easyt to use once you get your brewing ratio. The cord is long as you can see if the pick but its easy to bend and hide. With a larger brew coffee often drips out of spout onto counter when pouring. I dont regret spending the money, hopefully will last!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tasting coffee!
customer_reviews.text: It took me a while to decide on a coffee maker to buy (because I have never owned one before). And the price of this one was pretty high but when you factor how much you spend on brewed coffee at the local shops and you never have a consistency with the brews. Sometimes it’s old or over-brewed or weak tasting, burnt, or bitter. This coffee maker makes all of those irritating inconsistencies go away!! This coffee maker is worth the price! I have had this machine for a week and it makes the most amazing coffee! Not bitter, full bodied, not oily, tasty coffee. They tout it to be the gold standard. Moccamaster!
customer_reviews.author: Weblvr2177

customer_reviews.title: Worth It
customer_reviews.text: This definitely makes the best coffee I’ve ever had from a pour over machine! Easy to set up, easy to use, and pretty easy to clean. The only disappointment is none of it can go in the dishwasher. Make sure that you use a good quality coffee when you use this. If you put in poor quality, it’s not going to help that.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C.

customer_reviews.title: Quality Coffee Brewer, Awesome Machine!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Technivorm 59616 KBG coffee brewer, I dont think I would be considered a coffee expert but I drink a lot of coffee and I usually spend a few dollars each day. The Technivorm coffee brewer is quality, I like that it is made with parts that will last a long time, large selection of color choices, and comes with a five year warranty. I like hot coffee, so this coffee brewer was perfect for me. I would recommend the Technivorm coffee brewer for anyone who likes a great cup of coffee and a coffee brewer that was built to last.
customer_reviews.author: E Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: After 2 years of ogling, finally placed an order when the price went down $50 or so. Brews hot, flavorful coffee and its bare bones nature clearly reflect Techni’s goal: it’s about the coffee, not the timers, grinders, comveniences. Once you have the process down pat, coffee brewing is a cinch. Some parts seem like they aren’t in it for the long run (rubber spout), but the quality and design is terrific Don’t hesitate to ditch the Mr Coffee and invest in taste. You only live once.
customer_reviews.author: N. Sharif

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: After hearing about the excellence of these units for a long time, I finally decided to find out for myself. I generally French press when I have the time but was using a bunn for when it’s not just me having coffee. When my bunn finally died I was in the market for a replacement. I was a little skeptical about spending this much for a coffee maker but the coffee it makes would be a bargain at twice the price. When paired with a good fresh ground quality bean, this will complete with my best hand power over. Buy the best and only cry once.
customer_reviews.author: DiamondW

customer_reviews.title: It’s very nice
customer_reviews.text: I’ll keep it simple, compared to these other reviews. Yes, it’s expensive, but that’s what the stimulus check was for. But, it’s a really nice high quality piece. From the first cup you can tell it makes a good cup of coffee. So, if you like good coffee and high quality appliances that don’t have to be replaced often, then get this. That is all.
customer_reviews.author: Keith V. Cieplinski

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee pot
customer_reviews.text: I'm obsessed with this coffee pot!!! Best decision I've made this year (so far). I love that any part that comes in contact with coffee comes off for easy cleaning. I purchased this and a conical burr grinder on the same day and I've had perfect coffee every morning since. My only critique is the width of the cord. It makes it hard to hide.
customer_reviews.author: Katy A.

customer_reviews.title: it’s easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my dad, it’s easy to use, to clean and make a good cup of coffee for him to use it every morning. UPDATE: per Technivorm’s feedback, i re-read user manual and I edited my review by removing the part about lacking auto shutoff. TBH, manual have it worded as an option depending on the model. I did finally noticed outside of the box is labeled as auto shutoff.
customer_reviews.author: BookGenius

customer_reviews.title: Stop reading this review and just buy it now
customer_reviews.text: This brewer is a notch above the competition. It makes tastier coffee than my other drip machine, a Bonavita BV1800 (also an SCA Certified Home Brewer). The coffee is always perfectly hot and smooth. I grind with the Capresso Infinity Conical Burr Grinder fresh every morning, and the results are great! Don't hesitate to spend the money, go for this one right away! I wish I had gotten it years ago!
customer_reviews.author: David Schmitt

customer_reviews.title: Glass Carafe Doesn't Keep Coffee Hot at All
customer_reviews.text: Great tasting coffee, but you have to drink it immediately with the glass carafe. I should have purchased the thermos version. Even though the instructions indicate that it keeps coffee hot for up to an hour, I just poured a second cup after about 15 min and it's only lukewarm. With Thanksgiving coming up and lots of house guests, I'm going to have to put it into a thermos to keep it hot enough for guests. Having to microwave every cup after the first is annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Heddy123

customer_reviews.title: quality slow drip coffee
customer_reviews.text: I have had a lot of coffee makers and this one is right up there. Its not going to transform your coffee, its not that big of a difference. But here is what stands out. Slow drop cone filters seem to make a sold mild cup of coffee. Not bitter, not too strong. I buy whole beans and grind them to my liking which is somewhat medium to fine on the grind.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Coffee
customer_reviews.text: I can’t say enough about how wonderful this coffee maker goes above and beyond it’s impressive results. I had such anxiety about spending so much on a coffee maker at this price point. But most coffee makers I’ve own over the years all work fine out of the box but soon detour downhill after the glory of a few months. This coffee maker is simple to operate, consistently delicious coffee every time, and consistently stays hot and delicious, pot after pot. I can’t see myself ever using another. This is the gold staple of Coffee Maker as it was meant to be. Take a deep breath and just buy it, you won’t ever go back.
customer_reviews.author: Julian A

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee maker!
customer_reviews.text: I've wanted one of these for several years, and when the opportunity arrived (I got spousal permission due to family visiting and needing a larger capacity coffee maker) I made the purchase. It's makes wonderful coffee as the brewing temperature is spot on. It's easy to clean and maintain. After five months of use, I'm a completely satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Randi R.

customer_reviews.title: Makes nice strong coffee EVERY time.
customer_reviews.text: I was SO sick of warm watery coffee. I have no idea how this coffee maker brews such strong coffee, but it does. Honestly. No more weak coffee!! This machine doesn't do anything fancy, but my coffee is amazing. We've had the model for over a year now, and our coffee tastes just as great as it did when we got it. So worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: J Champ

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Quility
customer_reviews.text: I have had the coffee pot for over a year, and I love it! I had a hard time spending this much for a coffee pot. I had known about the "Moccamaster" for years, but past it over to buy other nam brand coffee pots (you name the company,and I have owned it. After my 4th $100 dollar coffee pot, I justified this one by saying to my self, Its a simple design, and the manufacture supports it. Best of all It makes really good coffee!
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Gannon

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Auto-start hack 😼
customer_reviews.text: 🧡☕️Didn’t get this originally because wanted the auto on despite their reasoning for not “stale” water. I agree but life is life and I like to smell the coffee brewing before I get up. Got an amazon Alexa smart plug and set a routine works perfectly 👌🏼. And the coffee! 🙀 I didn’t know coffee could be that good. Make the investment. Only thing is pot glass is thin and I’ll prob get a spare to have around. If it’s so the coffee is good don’t change it 🤚🏼... just think I need to order an extra.
customer_reviews.author: Kansas

customer_reviews.title: Live and learn
customer_reviews.text: This model doesn't really allow for steeping the grounds before draining into the pot. I have learned set coffee filter holder at an angle that doesn't trigger the trap door that releases the water into the pot. This way I can trap the water and the grounds together until they have mingled for a little while. This trick only works if you are making a single cup, otherwise it will overflow. Wish I had purchased a model that allows for the grounds to become more saturated.
customer_reviews.author: t'nman

customer_reviews.title: Worth it if you have the $$$
customer_reviews.text: I wanted the best coffee maker that didn't have a clock in it. I wanted the best coffee maker that doesn't have a bunch a flashy features. I wanted to spend a lot of money of a coffee maker where every penny counted towards making a good cup of coffee and not for some gimmicks I could care less about. This is that coffee maker. It's simple. Easy to use. Brews fast. Tastes great. Use it properly and you will be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Michael

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee
customer_reviews.text: most importantly, it does make a good cup of coffee. For the price, I was a bit disappointed that the plastic parts are a bit flimsy and the coffee carafe could be a better design. Unless you pour extremely slow water/coffee spills all over. I guess first thing in the morning I can be a little impatient. Overall, this is about the simplest coffee maker you can buy, no bells and whistles, not much for design... but if you want a good consistent pot of coffee, this is the one.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: Love this coffee maker. Had an old one with the Metal Carafe but it kept leaking at the middle seam. I could not tell how much coffee was left in it. This is an easy to use coffee maker and keeps the water at the correct temp for making coffee not too hot or not too cold. Amazing coffee maker. A must have.
customer_reviews.author: VartLiv

customer_reviews.title: Smells good. Works great.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Beautiful copper, tinted slightly more pink, but still gorgeous. Finally, the coffee maker didn't stink of chemicals or toxic plastic. Was comforting unboxing a coffee machine that didn't have that unsettling and lingering scent of a slow death. Nice so far.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Miller

customer_reviews.title: So glad we bought this
customer_reviews.text: Flavor is excellent, and easily rivals what I used to get at the local coffee shop - though I admit we changed from 2% milk to heavy cream (gotta spoil yourself sometimes). Only nit I have is that I feel like some of the coffee goes to waste. So, as an experiment I took the used grounds, stirred them up and used them again. Still a lot of coffee flavor, but all of the bitterness and acid came though. Depending on your level of desperation... oh never mind - just don't do it.
customer_reviews.author: Philip C. Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: First of all the coffee tastes great. Honestly the best I’ve had from a drip machine. The second best thing is that the spray arm comes off and can be easily cleaned. I have hard water and this is very important. You don’t need to clean it every time but I try to do it about every 100 pots. Additionally, replacement parts including the spray arm are readily available something you don’t often find with small appliances.
customer_reviews.author: L. Louise

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic coffee and simple to use.
customer_reviews.text: Makes terrific coffee. Simple to use, simple to operate, and simple to clean. My sister has owned one for over 10 years so I'm expecting a long life out of mine. Plugged mine into a smart plug so I can start the coffee in the morning as I get up. By the time I get downstairs, a fresh, piping-hot pot is waiting for me.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: The used machine had stale coffee and mold on packaging overpowered the flavor of the brew.
customer_reviews.text: It was used when it showed up. It must be very difficult to clean since there were coffee stains on the carafe as well as dust and hairs on the machine. The coffee flavor was overpowered by the stale coffee smell and I think the hairs left in the water tank must have altered the taste of the water. Make sure you get a new unit instead of a used one (like the one sent to me) to get the best results.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If it won’t break the bank and you want to treat yourself
customer_reviews.text: It’s a luxury, and yet it is incredibly simple and almost feels old-fashioned. No gimmicks, bells or whistles. It’s a pleasure to observe in operation. The components are satisfyingly easy to remove and clean when necessary. Brews at a temp that suits my preference. I’ve read other reviews that reported uneven saturation of grounds in the brew chamber. I have not experienced this yet, and have actually noticed a flat-bed after each brewing. Bottom line: is it worth $300? I’m not sure I’m qualified or educated enough to render such a sweeping judgment. Am I happy with the purchase? Yes.
customer_reviews.author: JSB

customer_reviews.title: This One's a Keeper!
customer_reviews.text: Moccamaster is the coffee maker I've been waiting for. Beautifully crafted both inside and out. Lots of cool colors to chose from. But -- the improved taste is the key. This has got to be the smoothest home brew ever! Wow! Using the same beans I've used in other coffee makers for years so the difference is stunning. Metal - not plastic. Made in the Netherlands. Spendy. But, this one's a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn-Dyanna

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee
customer_reviews.text: I live in Korea, where 220V is supplied. Per Technivorm customer support's recommendation, I use Moccamaster with a voltage converter. No problem so far. It brews coffee beautifully. Honestly, it's better than most cafe purchased coffee. I would give it 5 stars if it had not been for the glass carafe. The glass is too thin. Everytime I handle the carafe, I worry about breaking it. The plastic lid is bit flimsy as well. While less aesthetically appealing, I suggest purchasing the metal carafe models.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Lee

customer_reviews.title: Improves the taste of coffee
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical, because a higher price doesn’t always mean higher quality. The design is well thought through. It is easy to use and clean. I tested the same coffee in this coffee maker and in a Cuisinart. It is better in the Moccamaster. If you like to keep your coffee pot out, it fits under your standard cabinet and looks nice, too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love At First Brew
customer_reviews.text: Admittedly, I am a total coffee snob. I researched coffeemakers for over a year, and ultimately, I finally committed to giving the Technivorm Moccamaster KBG a try. I am completely in love with this coffee brewer. It brews an entire pot in about 4min. The taste is consistent throughout the entire pot. The temperature is always perfect. It is easy to use, and it looks gorgeous in our kitchen. The cost is steep, but so far, it is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Makes excellent coffee
customer_reviews.text: Between the Mocamaster coffee maker and the breville grinder we have finally found a way to make coffee that is better than Starbucks or any coffee shop. Instead of stopping for coffee every morning, we now make our own and save $5 per day. This is the third set we have purchased for us and our family.
customer_reviews.author: tnb

customer_reviews.title: Great Machine
customer_reviews.text: We are coffee hounds. Meaning we drink coffee from anywhere and like trying new blends. We do know what we like, and this coffee Brewer is what gives good beans the touch they need to add the extra aroma and flavor to your brew choice. We use a Kangen water filter machine, which if you know this brand, you know how serious we are about finding the best for taste. This is one of the few luxuries we afford ourselves and the people who live here with us. This machine does all it says and takes us less space that some of the machines I have had.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Judy

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite purchases
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Technivorm Moccamaster 59616 KBG Coffee Brewer, 40 oz, Polished Silver unit a few years ago and am as happy with it today as I was when I first purchased, probably even more so because I was a bit hesitant on the cost but it continues to brew great consistent coffee day after day. Its a splurge but I use it at least once a day and it performs day after day.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Connolly

customer_reviews.title: B E S T ever
customer_reviews.text: Best coffeemaker I could buy most happy and proud to have the finest never looked back get the grinder they offer and roast your own beans
customer_reviews.author: lisa

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I had wanted to buy this for a long time as both my parents and a brother have had Moccamaster machines for years (and have served me great coffee during visits). When my old machine recently died, I immediately bought it and cannot be more pleased. Rich smooth flavor. Big difference and well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Anders O. Halvorsen

customer_reviews.title: Didn't make hot coffee
customer_reviews.text: I've had a Technivorm Moccamaster for years and wanted to replace and upgrade. This particular one didn't produce hot coffee. Technivorm is a great brand. Think the unit was defective. Returned and Amazone refunded the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: D. P.

customer_reviews.title: Smooth coffee.
customer_reviews.text: This beautiful coffee maker brews the best coffee I have ever made. I don't use any kind of special coffee and I don't grind it myself, just buy at the grocery store and keep in air tight canister. The coffee stays good even if I don't drink it right away, the warmer plate keeps it at the perfect temperature. I'm not a coffee expert but I do drink a pot every day, so this was money well spent, glad I bought it. I got the white one and it is very nice looking in my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bulla

customer_reviews.title: Great!  But worth the money...?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because this is the one that America’s test kitchen said stood out among all of those that they tested. It was on sale so I went ahead and picked it up. It’s a great coffee maker and I’m very pleased. Honestly though, I’m not sure that I can tell much difference beyond any other quality drip coffee maker. That having been said, it’s a great coffee maker and if you have the money to spend, go ahead!
customer_reviews.author: Gregory M Peters

customer_reviews.title: Technivorm  Moccamaster  coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: Best coffee maker ever. My husband says his coffee tastes like the great coffee we had in Europe. Brews the water hotter and every coffee he tries tastes delicious. If you love coffee, don’t waster ,only on made in china coffee makers. This is the best.
customer_reviews.author: tutucat

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely worth the money and you definitely should buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my wife and she was raised in Seattle. She also was a barista for years so she knows coffee. More importantly she loves coffee and doesn’t like Starbucks. So she can actually taste the quality of the coffee and that makes the maker I get her very important. I researched quite a bit on this topic and I was glad to find this product but the price seemed ridiculous. The more I looked into it the price made sense. It makes amazing coffee and is absolutely worth the extra money. Plus it looks very cool on the counter.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee
customer_reviews.text: Love this coffee maker , Best one around , fast ,quiet . Easy to use an clean . Just doesn’t have a big Anerican style caraffe . Its euro cup sized , meaning we americans like large mugs of coffee vs euro small style cups . But bottom line makes a great hot professional coffee with your choice of grounds !!
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: the most worthwhile investment you will ever make
customer_reviews.text: a lifetime of perfect coffee? a perfect cup every time you pour? a worry-free purchase with lifetime support, replaceable parts and quality engineering? do you need this? cus i did, and this coffee maker provided! on a serious note i had some when i visited europe from a moccamaster and ive been dying for good coffee since i left, i dont understand how much different the technology is, it seems so simple but the results prove otherwise. if you buy this coffeemaker and you dont agree with me i'll let you come punch me in the face.
customer_reviews.author: Loomis

customer_reviews.title: My dream machine doesn’t exist
customer_reviews.text: I researched a lot of machines - previously had a Wilfa, but wasn’t thrilled with that either. Bought this based on reviews and 5 year warranty. Have had the Technivorm for a month now. What I like: fast brew and good flavor, water dispenser pops off for easy cleaning. What could be improved: carafe spills while pouring, plastic top to reservoir doesn’t sit well, Plastic feels light and cheap for an expensive machine, coffee basket doesn’t lift smoothly - gets stuck. Not unhappy, but not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Colatrella

customer_reviews.title: Love this coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: I'm an avid coffee drinker. I have always used pour over to get the best flavor from the beans. I tried this because #1 I'm impressed with the workmanship, it's easy to use and fast and makes a great cup of coffee. Not exactly like pour over, but as close as I've come to any coffee makers out there.
customer_reviews.author: Cass

product_meta.title: Technivorm Moccamaster KBG Coffee Brewer, 40 oz, Copper
product_meta.description: Color:Copper| Style:Coffee BrewerThe Moccamaster KBG coffeemaker features a glass carafe and an automatic drip-stop brew-basket that stops the flow of coffee if the carafe is pulled away. The KBG brews a full 40oz pot of Coffee in six minutes. Coffee is then held on our unique hot-plate; which is engineered with a separate, independent element that rolls heat into the coffee to ensure an even taste from the first cup to the last drop. The hot-plate has two settings, giving you the choice to hold your coffee between 175° and 185° F, while never burning your Coffee. After 100 minutes, The hot-plate will automatically turn-off. All Moccamaster coffeemakers are handmade in the Netherlands and backed by an industry leading 5-year.
feature_bullets: The top coffee maker choice of coffee brewing experts
Easy use, one button Operation and 4-6 minute brew time for 40 oz of Coffee
Perfectly brewed Coffee Delivered by our Copper element and no Pumps
Coffee maker features an auto shut off after 100 minutes. BPA/BPS/BPF & Phthalate Free

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,854 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
